title: The Value of Wisdom
shortSummary: Proverbs chapter 2 emphasizes the pursuit of wisdom and understanding as essential for living a righteous and protected life. It teaches that God grants wisdom to those who diligently seek it, leading to discernment that guards against evil and guides one in the paths of righteousness. This chapter highlights the blessings and security that come from fearing the Lord and walking in His ways.
timeline: Traditionally attributed to Solomon, c. 10th century BC, during the united monarchy period of Israel

keyCharacters.name: The Father
keyCharacters.description: The speaker who imparts wisdom and instruction to his son, urging him to seek understanding and live righteously.

keyCharacters.name: The Son
keyCharacters.description: The recipient of the father's wisdom, representing the learner or disciple who is called to pursue knowledge and fear the Lord.

keyCharacters.name: The Evil Man
keyCharacters.description: A figure representing those who reject righteousness, walk in darkness, and speak perversely, from whom the wise are warned to turn away.

keyCharacters.name: The Strange Woman
keyCharacters.description: A symbol of temptation and unfaithfulness who entices the unwary away from the covenant with God, leading to death.

definitions.definition: A reverential awe and respect for God that leads to obedience and wisdom.
A small shield; metaphorically, God's protection for the righteous.
Perverse or stubbornly contrary behavior or speech.
The ability to judge wisely and avoid danger or sin.

outline.heading: The Call to Seek Wisdom
outline.description: The father urges the son to receive and treasure his words, actively seeking wisdom and understanding as valuable treasures that lead to the knowledge of God and the fear of the Lord.

outline.heading: God as the Source and Protector of Wisdom
outline.description: Wisdom, knowledge, and understanding come from the LORD, who stores up sound wisdom for the righteous and protects those who walk uprightly.

outline.heading: The Benefits of Wisdom
outline.description: Receiving wisdom leads to understanding righteousness, judgment, and equity, and grants discretion and understanding that preserve and keep the believer.

outline.heading: Wisdom Delivers from Evil
outline.description: Wisdom protects from the influence of the evil man who walks in darkness, speaks perversely, and delights in wickedness.

outline.heading: Wisdom Guards Against Temptation
outline.description: Wisdom delivers from the seductive 'strange woman' who forsakes God’s covenant and leads to death and destruction.

outline.heading: The Outcome of Walking in Wisdom
outline.description: The wise walk in the paths of the righteous, resulting in dwelling securely in the land, while the wicked are cut off and removed.

application: Diligently seek God’s wisdom through prayer and study of Scripture, valuing it above earthly treasures.
Trust that God grants wisdom and protection to those who walk uprightly and fear Him.
Use discernment to avoid the influence of evil people and temptations that lead away from God’s covenant.
Commit to living righteously so that you may enjoy God’s blessings and security in life.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms that true wisdom and understanding originate from God alone.

keyVerses.text: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the internal transformation and joy that comes from embracing wisdom.

keyVerses.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
keyVerses.significance: This verse warns of the dangers of temptation and the protective power of wisdom.

keyVerses.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
keyVerses.significance: It promises security and blessing for those who live righteously.
